channel.title: Moment Junkie

item.title: The Howl
item.dc:creator: Kyle Hepp
item.description: I love dogs. I love this photo. I love this groom scolding his pup during the first kiss. WIN. Photo by: Carly Bish, Seattle wedding photographer Shot on: Nikon D700 with Nikon 35mm f/1.4G Camera Info: ISO 1600, f1.4, 1/100sec
item.content:encoded:
I love dogs. I love this photo. I love this groom scolding his pup during the first kiss. WIN.

Photo by: Carly Bish, Seattle wedding photographer

Shot on: Nikon D700 with Nikon 35mm f/1.4G 

Camera Info: ISO 1600, f1.4, 1/100sec

item.title: The Groom Sings Along
item.dc:creator: Kyle Hepp
item.description: We’re trying something new here guys! Moment Junkie has grown and grown and grown since its birth and we (Kyle, Chris and Ryan, plus a countless number of kind volunteers) have put a ton of hard work into it. We think it’s time to start monetizing and we hope that you’ll support us in that [...]
item.content:encoded:
We’re trying something new here guys! Moment Junkie has grown and grown and grown since its birth and we (Kyle, Chris and Ryan, plus a countless number of kind volunteers) have put a ton of hard work into it. We think it’s time to start monetizing and we hope that you’ll support us in that endeavor. From here on out, photos will be accompanied by camera info with affiliate links. And, in an effort to make this site more of a learning tool for all the wedding photographers that read us, we’ll try and post the shot info as well so you have better insight onto how your favorite Moment Junkie masters are shooting. So do us a favor and when you’re going on a new gear binge, go nuts with our links! Thanks!

And please, review our revised submission guidelines, as we’ve made a few changes!

 

Photo by: Jessica Bosse, Toronto wedding photographer.

Shot on: Nikon D700 with Nikon 24-70mm f/2.8G 

Camera Info:

Shutter: 1/50
Aperture: 2.8
ISO: 1000

item.title: The Squeeze
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Photos like this one, from Chicago wedding photographer Steve Koo give me a glimpse into what it will be like if I have a daughter.
item.content:encoded: Photos like this one, from Chicago wedding photographer Steve Koo give me a glimpse into what it will be like if I have a daughter.

item.title: The Loving Hand Kiss
item.dc:creator: Kyle Hepp
item.description: Yeah, that’s my own (me being Kyle Hepp) photo. Whatever, Chris told me to submit it and it was vetted sufficiently by enough other great photographers that I think it’s earned its spot on Moment Junkie :)
item.content:encoded: Yeah, that’s my own (me being Kyle Hepp) photo. Whatever, Chris told me to submit it and it was vetted sufficiently by enough other great photographers that I think it’s earned its spot on Moment Junkie :)

item.title: The Rainbow Sprinkle Exit
item.dc:creator: Kat Braman
item.description: North Carolina photographer Bridget McEnaney had me at rainbow sprinkles. I’ll take this over sparklers any wedding day.
item.content:encoded: North Carolina photographer Bridget McEnaney had me at rainbow sprinkles.  I’ll take this over sparklers any wedding day.

item.title: The Proud Parents
item.dc:creator: Kat Braman
item.description: Any parent can look at this photo sent in by Guillermo Alessandri and imagine exactly the mix of emotions this mom and dad are feeling.
item.content:encoded: Any parent can look at this photo sent in by Guillermo Alessandri and imagine exactly the mix of emotions this mom and dad are feeling.

item.title: The Grandfather’s Dance
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Kevin Le Vu Photography of Orange County, California sent in this super-adorable and sweet shot of the grandfather dancing with the bride.
item.content:encoded: Kevin Le Vu Photography of Orange County, California sent in this super-adorable and sweet shot of the grandfather dancing with the bride.

item.title: The Jump
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: The groom gives a jump of excitement at having just been pronounced man and wife! From Jon Tan, New York City photographer of Dreamlite Photography.
item.content:encoded: The groom gives a jump of excitement at having just been pronounced man and wife! From Jon Tan, New York City photographer of Dreamlite Photography.

item.title: The Cathedral Reunion
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: World’s greatest collection of greatest hugging photos. This one from Dieter of Speaking Through Silence Photography in Brussels, Belgium.
item.content:encoded: World’s greatest collection of greatest hugging photos. This one from Dieter of Speaking Through Silence Photography in Brussels, Belgium.

item.title: The Rugby Run
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Rugby is big in South Africa, and the couple and their friends are avid fans: the groom is captain of his local club team, and they even had a rugby ball as a guest message book. After the groomsmen portraits with a rugby ball (a different one, I hope?), without warning the bride sneaked in, [...]
item.content:encoded: Rugby is big in South Africa, and the couple and their friends are avid fans: the groom is captain of his local club team, and they even had a rugby ball as a guest message book. After the groomsmen portraits with a rugby ball (a different one, I hope?), without warning the bride sneaked in, grabbed the ball and made a run for it! Christelle Rall of Cape Town adds that their wedding was also on the same day as The Currie Cup!

item.title: The Reception Reveal Reaction
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: There’s no tradition or superstition about not seeing the reception venue before you get there, right? The bride sees her sister’s email with photos of the setup, eliciting this. Sent in by Perry Vaile of North Carolina.
item.content:encoded: There’s no tradition or superstition about not seeing the reception venue before you get there, right? The bride sees her sister’s email with photos of the setup, eliciting this. Sent in by Perry Vaile of North Carolina.

item.title: The Loose Tears
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: In this photo from Madalena Tavares Photography, the maid of honor is trying hard to hold back her tears, but can’t. The best man, of course, tries to blow her tears away.
item.content:encoded: In this photo from Madalena Tavares Photography, the maid of honor is trying hard to hold back her tears, but can’t. The best man, of course, tries to blow her tears away.

item.title: The Raise
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Wellington, New Zealand wedding photographer Mary Sylvia sent this in, with her description, “I see your Bollinger champagne, and I raise you one awesome snack box.” Snack boxes are important.
item.content:encoded: Wellington, New Zealand wedding photographer Mary Sylvia sent this in, with her description, “I see your Bollinger champagne, and I raise you one awesome snack box.” Snack boxes are important.

item.title: The Laughter at the Crying
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Energy Photographic‘s Sean sends this in. The bride, he says, is laughing at the fact the groom is crying.
item.content:encoded: Energy Photographic‘s Sean sends this in. The bride, he says, is laughing at the fact the groom is crying.

item.title: The Giver
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Chattanooga, Tennessee wedding photographer Alex Bee reports that the bride was SO excited to give her groom his gift after they saw each other for the first time.
item.content:encoded: Chattanooga, Tennessee wedding photographer Alex Bee reports that the bride was SO excited to give her groom his gift after they saw each other for the first time.

item.title: The “Dodge This”
item.dc:creator: Chris Lin
item.description: Groom dodging a cake smash plus sunglasses. If my future bride tries this, I’ll tell her “Stop trying to hit me, and hit me!” Ashley Jackson Photo of Red Deer.
item.content:encoded: Groom dodging a cake smash plus sunglasses. If my future bride tries this, I’ll tell her “Stop trying to hit me, and hit me!” Ashley Jackson Photo of Red Deer.

item.title: The Ring Bearer’s Tears
item.dc:creator: Kat Braman
item.description: The bride’s little brother teared up when it was time to give up the rings; sent in by Chile photographer Mariano Sfiligoy.
item.content:encoded: The bride’s little brother teared up when it was time to give up the rings; sent in by Chile photographer Mariano Sfiligoy.

item.title: The Handoff
item.dc:creator: Kat Braman
item.description: We can’t blame the dad for not wanting to let go in this fun photo from Woodnote Photography.
item.content:encoded: We can’t blame the dad for not wanting to let go in this fun photo from Woodnote Photography.

item.title: The Last Kiss
item.dc:creator: Kat Braman
item.description: We’re crazy about the guy in the awesome leopard-print shirt. Great perspective by Lancashire photographer Hannah Dornford-May.
item.content:encoded: We’re crazy about the guy in the awesome leopard-print shirt.  Great perspective by Lancashire photographer Hannah Dornford-May.

item.title: The Wedded Getaway
item.dc:creator: Kat Braman
item.description: Between the bride’s expression and all that movement, this one from Lake Tahoe photographer Chris Werner, was an instant winner.
item.content:encoded: Between the bride’s expression and all that movement, this one from Lake Tahoe photographer Chris Werner, was an instant winner.
